summary: bronchiolitis obliterans syndrome stage 1 was complicated by bronchiolitis. the posttransplant period was complicated by bronchiolitis obliterans syndrome stage 1. the immunosuppressive regimen included tacrolimus, low-dose steroids, and monthly courses of extracorporeal photopheresis. virus was detected by a nested RT-PCR targeting the 5′ untranslated region (UTR) (1). the 316-bp 5′ UTR amplicon was sequenced using an ABI Prism 3100 DNA automatic sequencer. nucleotide identity with the HCoSV species D (species D1) was 93%. bootstrap values were set for 1,000 repetitions and were placed over each main node of the tree. the strain from the lung transplant recipient with chronic diarrhea, in Italy, is indicated in boldface. 689 patients with gastrointestinal symptoms were hospitalized and tested during the same period. the patient denied domestic or international travel and close contact with persons returning from travel.
